"Do you think that's a good idea?" Ellie asked not taking her eyes off of the phone.

"What?" Josh chuckled. "It's mine now." As he looked through the contents, he found a mirror. Having not really seen himself since being changed. When he looked into the mirror, Josh let out an audible gasp. His face had changed into a more feminine form and his lips were thicker. "Wow." He turned to Ellie. "This is so c..." He stopped dead in his tracks as he watched Ellie's brown hair change into Rebekah's blonde color.

Ellie met his gaze with a smile. "I know right." She took some of her new hair in her hands to get a better look at it. "I was thinking that tomorrow, we could find some people that are almost always together and swap with them."

"Like who?" Josh wondered as he looked into the mirror to check out his changed mouth.

"I don't know yet, but maybe we could swap with some customers and just hang out in the store." Ellie offered, thinking about a plan that she could get Josh into another feminine role. Thinking about this seemed to make her chuckle a little bit.
1111332311321313331121.title: Before break ends, Ellie is swapped again.

choices: The wait continues for another swap.
11113323113213133311211.content:
The rest of break passed without incident, not that either minded. Especially not Ellie now that she had Rebekah's blonde hair, she was ecstastic to say the least. She was already looking forward to another round with the device, confident that she was going to win this round. Although she had to admit, Josh was holding up well despite now having quite a few of Charlotte's physical traits. Maybe he'll give in soon. She thought with a chuckle.

As Liz politely told everyone to return to work, the employees began to file out of the tea room. Ellie and Josh were the last out, and they followed their co-workers back down onto the shop floor.

They were both expecting another swap to happen any moment. "You know its getting harder to concentrate on work right?" Josh muttered to Ellie, which made her chuckle. Even his tone sounded like Charlotte's, that slight whine she had now and then.

"Understandable, but try not to slack too much, or you'll worsen Charlotte's rep." She laughed.

"Is that possible?" Josh joked, before they had to head to their respective aisles. "See you in a bit." He waved with one of his smaller, feminine hands. Ellie nodded, smiled and then disappeared from his view. Upon reaching his aisle, he let out a girly sigh and put his hands on his hips. "Oh well, I suppose it will happen on it's own, like usual." He told himself, getting back to work.
11113323113213133311211.title: Break is over.

111133231132131333112113.content:
Josh reluctantly made his way back to the aisle that he was working on with Jade. As he grew nearer, he felt an odd shiver go through him. "I wonder what that was?" Josh quietly replied to himself. The more and more he spoke with Charlotte's voice, the more that it seemed to grow on him. The more that he thought about it, the more Charlotte reminded him of somebody close to him. He stopped for a minute and thought about it, but couldn't put a finger on it. Josh knew that he was married, but couldn't remember her name.

"Welcome back, Charlotte." Jade greeted him with a smile.

"Hey Jade." Josh returned the greeting as he sighed. "I'm really ready to go home."

"I hear you on that one." Jade chuckled as she opened another box. "But we're almost done."

For the next several minutes, Jade continued to tell Josh everything that was going on in her life. About the latest band that she was into and the next time that they would be playing. "I know that you're not really into that type of music, buy maybe you can come with me and we can hit on some of the guys." She nudged Josh slightly.

"First off, the type of music that you listen to is really grating to my ears and secondly, if I wanted to meet some hot guys, I would head on over to the pub." Josh replied without thinking and stopped for a moment. 'Why did I say that?' He thought to himself. He usually was the type of person that kept his opinion to himself. 'I guess, I got some of her personality.'
111133231132131333112113.title: Josh gets another swap.

1111332311321313331121132.content:
"You know a simple 'no' would have been enough." Jade sighed, obviously irritated by the response she had got from "Charlotte". Then again, she didn't really expect anything different. She just thought she'd see if she wanted a night out some time, maybe mellow her out.

"Look, I just don't like the same things as you Jade, okay." Josh said, trying to apologize. But a part of him didn't want to, he had got his point across and that was that. He had to wonder whether that was how Charlotte felt the whole time.

"Oh and for your information, the guys I can find at these concerts are way cuter than the drunks you find in the pub." Jade said, showing a little of her own bitchy side.

This just seemed to inflame the situation, and Josh automatically found himself retaliating as Charlotte would have.

"Maybe you should fix that rat's nest of a hairstyle before going hunting for guys, hmm?" He snapped at Jade, who spun around, her eyes burning two holes right through him. He instantly knew that might have gone too far., but again... he didn't really care all that much anymore.

"You know I just realized why nobody else likes you in this place." Jade barked back at Josh.

"Whatever!" Josh sighed, in the exact tone of voice Charlotte usually used. "How about we just get back to work, hmm?" He suggested, eliciting a sharp nod from Jade. The tension between them was palpable after that, and rarely another word was said unless it was work related. Jade remained annoyed, but Josh soon was behaving normal again. Except it was Charlotte's kind of "normal".
1111332311321313331121132.title: Josh says the wrong thing.

11113323113213133311211323.content:
"What the bloody hell is going on here?" Liz asked as she entered the aisle that the two of them were 'working.' She turned to Josh. "I swear Charlotte, it seems that I can't leave you for a moment. When I give you an inch, you always seem to take a mile." Josh chuckled slightly at the use of the American phrase.

"Liz, I think she needs to go work somewhere else." Jade snapped as she put her hands on her hips in a defiant manner. "I swear, if I have to work with her anymore..." She took a deep breath and let it out slowly to control her temper.

"I understand love." Liz replied as she turned toward Josh. "Charlotte, I want you to go work with Rebekah. You two seemed to hit it off a little earlier tonight."

"What?" Josh argued thinking that he was getting the short end of the stick. "She was the one that instigated it all." He nearly yelled as he pointed his finger in her direction."

"That may be the case, but you're the one that's raising your voice and causing the scene." Liz responded in a casual tone. Something that her son always seemed to test, but somehow she kept her cool

"Figures you would take her side." Josh pouted as he folded his arms across his chest. "You never give me a chance to defend myself."

"Just go." Liz pointed in the direction that 'Rebekah' was working. "Just go, before I do something that I know I'll regret." Letting out an audible sigh, Josh did as he was asked and made his way over to the area that Ellie was working.

Ellie turned around and saw Josh coming towards her. "What was going on over there?" Ellie asked as she grinned broadly. "I heard some arguing and didn't know what was going on?"

"I'll tell you what was going on." Josh huffed. "That bitch, Jade, was wanting to go to some concert to go pick up guys and I just told her that if I wanted to get guys, that I would just go to the pub. That way the guys will buy me drinks." He giggled at the thought of playing guys along just to get what he wanted.

"What's going on with you." Ellie asked taken aback at how he was acting. She looked around to make sure that the Liz wasn't nearby and took out the device. Opening it up, she asked. "What is going on with Josh?" The device seemed to come to life and blinked it's lights to simulate thinking.

Player Josh's personality isn't strong enough for target Charlotte's personality. The result is target Charlotte's personality has effectively overridden Player Josh's.


Ellie was at a loss for words. She looked back to the device. "Is there a way to fix this?" Once again, the device seemed to blink it's lights.

Player Ellie needs to change settings before next game so that this will not happen again. Forums indicate that this is a common problem with first time users.


Ellie looked back over at Josh, who for the first time since the break that they share, seemed to be himself. "Are you okay Josh?"

Josh shook his head, trying to gain control and fight off the stronger personality. "It's hard to think straight." He replied as he looked back over at Ellie, who seemed concerned at the struggle her new friend was going through. "I don't want to stay this way." He then muttered the phrase that shocked Ellie the most. "I quit."

With those words uttered, the device once again came to life and Josh noticed a group of words in front of his eyes.

"Do you wish to forfeit?"


"Yes, I quit." Josh confirmed to the device. The lights continued to change color, almost as if it was computing the data. A small flash of light engulfed the two of them and they looked down to see that they were back to normal, much to Ellie's chagrin. Once again, she had to look up to see Josh, but was met with his deep blue eyes. She was shocked to see a message from the device.

Player Josh has quit.
Player Ellie is able to claim her prize.
11113323113213133311211323.title: Liz has heard them arguing.

choices: they get back to work for now.
111133231132131333112113232.content:
Ellie took a deep breath as she studied Josh stood before her, returned to his usual self. To be honest she was surprised that she was getting to pick one of Josh's traits so soon, she hadn't expected him to quit yet. But then, given the unforseen incident with his personality being overridden by Charlotte's, she couldn't exactly blame him. "Go on then, take your pick." Josh grumbled, fearing for a certain part of his body in particular.

Luckily for him, Ellie didn't seem interested in having his penis, despite having a girl's normal curiosity. She first thought about taking Josh's face, but then rejected that idea. She liked her own face, considered it one of her best features in fact. People often called her 'cute', or 'pretty', which she was of course. Hmm, maybe his muscles? She mused, before wrinkling her nose up and shaking her head slightly.

"No really, take your time, keep me in suspense." Josh grumbled sarcastically, thinking Ellie was intentionally tormenting him.

"I'm thinking, not teasing you." Ellie assured him.

Josh slumped his shoulders, then nodded, which was his way of apologizing. All he could muster given his current predicament. He was just relieved not to be acting like such a bitch (Charlotte) anymore. He couldn't believe the way he had spoken to Jade, he actually felt guilty, and a part of him actually wondered whether it was smart to keep using the device, as wonderful as it was. He kept his doubts to himself as he looked up again at Ellie.

Ellie suddenly smiled a little, knowing what she wanted off Josh. Something she had always wanted... was to be a little taller. Having to use ladders to reach the top shelves, and just being shorter than most people around her, including her family, really annoyed her. This was her chance to remedy that. She raised the device up to her mouth and spoke softly into it. "Player Ellie wants Player Josh's height."

Josh opened his mouth to protest at first, but then refrained, knowing it wasn't too bad. However he started having second thoughts when he started shrinking in height, dwindling down to just 5'3" tall. He also watched as Ellie grew right in front of him until she had a full seven inches on him, standing at his former 5'10". Thankfully, both their clothes had resized to fit their new dimensions. "Well shit." Josh grumbled, glancing down at himself before looking 'up' at Ellie.

"Wow, this is awesome already." A delighted Ellie said, peering down at her shorter co-worker.

"Glad you're happy." Josh sighed. "Now what?" He asked.

Ellie smirked, then suggested...
111133231132131333112113232.title: Height

1111332311321313331121132323.content:
"Let's go again." Josh declared, in an attempt to get his height back from Ellie. He looked over at Ellie, who seemed to be enjoying her new height and was giddy, as she reached up and grabbed an item from the top most shelf.

"Hmm..." Ellie replied as she thought about it for a moment. "I don't think so, at least not yet." She brought her arms down and crossed them across her chest.

"Wait, what?" Josh nearly shouted as he brought his hands up to his mouth. He looked around to make sure that Liz or any other supervisor wasn't coming to check on them. After he decided that it was clear, Josh looked back over at Ellie and in a calmer, quieter voice he asked. "What do you mean not yet?"

Ellie stifled a giggle as she looked down at Josh. She couldn't help but find him even cuter in his smaller form. "Well, if we swap now, then we will have to go home in our new lives. So how about we go home and relax that way tomorrow we can start again." Josh didn't really want to do this, but ultimately agreed. "Good." Ellie replied as she playfully patted him on his head.

Grumbling to himself, Josh looked at the work that Charlotte, who had been living his life just moments ago, had done. Grabbing some of the items out of an open box, Josh looked for their location and noticed that their home was on the top shelf. Looking to see if he would able to reach it without any assistance, he soon found that it was indeed a little too high for him to reach. "Don't think about it." Liz's voice called out from the end of the aisle. "I don't want you to hurt yourself." Josh looked over where the voice was coming from. He noticed Liz was tapping her foot in an annoyed manner.

"Umm..." Josh stammered as he shook his head to get his bearings again. "Right, sorry." He blushed at being caught doing something wrong. Josh looked around and noticed the step stool sitting nearby. He grabbed it and used it to reach up to the top shelf. Looking back he noticed that Liz was gone, Josh looked over at Ellie. "So we're going to do this again tomorrow?" He asked as he carefully got down from the step stool.

"Yeah, but next time, I will set it for completely random." She suggested. "That way we have no control at who we swap with, how does that sound."

Josh thought about it for a moment and nodded his head. "I think we can do that." He chuckled as he continued. "Hell, I might even get to be a guy this time around." Ellie took a moment to think about being a guy too and couldn't wait for tomorrow to come.
1111332311321313331121132323.title: they get back to work for now.

11113323113213133311211323231.content:
When the end of the shift came, Ellie was tired enough to leave without really talking to anyone. The exception was Josh, whom she met up with outside the shop. Josh was just finishing a chat with Rebekah, whom Ellie had spent all evening swapping lives and body parts with. "So I'll bring the device to work with me tomorrow okay, then we can start swapping again." Ellie smiled, looking down at the shorter Josh.

"Sounds good. In fact after today, I can't wait." Josh nodded.

Ellie looked at him a little surprised. "I thought you hated being Charlotte?" She mumbled.

Josh nodded to confirm that. "Yeah, but having her body parts was exciting, arousing even, especially her breasts." He told Ellie, still not used to having to look up at her (and most of his other co-workers for that matter). The only employee shorter than Josh now was Kiran, and Phoebe was the same height as him, everyone else was taller.

"Well, glad you liked it. So I'll see you tomorrow." Ellie smiled bidding Josh a goodnight and leaving to catch the bus.

Josh made his way over to his car and got inside, then he adjusted the seat to account for his loss of height and drove home to his wife Marcie. He paused upon arrival at home, taking a deep breath. Shaking his head, he prepared himself and headed on inside. "Hey honey." He greeted Marcie, who was in the hallway having just returned from upstairs. He approached her and they embraced, sharing a kiss. Josh was also several inches shorter than his wife too, which made him feel even more... well, inadequate was the wrong word. But yeah...

"How was work?" Marcie asked with a smile, as Josh sniffed the air, smelling dinner.

"Oh, it was good, actually, I enjoyed it." Came Josh's reply, without going into any detail, obviously. He correctly figured he wouldn't be believed anyway if he told his wife some girl he worked with had swapped heights with him after winning a bizarre (but fun) game.

"That's nice, and now you get to have dinner with me. A perfect day right?" Marcie chuckled, walking into the living room.

"Absolutely." Josh nodded, winking at her. "Say I'm gonna get changed before dinner okay, I'll be back down in a bit." He added, before making his way upstairs. He knew it was going to be a pleasant evening with his lovely wife, but a part of him just wanted to get to sleep and get back to work again tomorrow.
11113323113213133311211323231.title: Following Josh at home.

choices: As Ellie puts the items up, the device falls out.
111133231132131333112113232311.content:
"Mum, I'm home." Ellie cried out to the seemingly empty house. She opened up the closet door and hung up her rain coat on one of the empty hangers. Closing the door, she noticed her mum coming out of the kitchen. "Oh, hey mum."

"Hey sweetie." Her mum greeted her as she gave her a plate full of the dinner that she made for her. "Here, I thought you might be hungry after working most of the night. So did you have a good night?" She asked as she looked over at the wall clock across the hall.

"Thanks Mum." Ellie replied as she took the plate from her and went over to the table to sit and eat. "Yeah, you can say it certainly was different." She smiled at the little inside joke.

"That's great." Her mum chuckled, not really getting the joke. After a minute or two of awkward silence, she looked around the kitchen spotting a couple pictures and a spice rack. "Oh, do you mind helping me hang these up? You know I'm not tall enough to reach up where I want them." Ellie, who had her mouth filled with food couldn't help but nod her head. She couldn't blame her, mostly since she inherited her small stature from her.

"I don't mind at all." Ellie replied with a smile and loving to feel important.

"Sometimes I wish I knew where you get your height from." Her mum asked with wonderment. "Must have got it from your dad's side."

"Definitely got it from somebody." Ellie chuckled as she finished up her dinner.
111133231132131333112113232311.title: Ellie's evening plans.

choices: The next day, arrival at work.
1111332311321313331121132323112.content:
After a delicious dinner, Josh and his wife Marcie snuggled up on the couch for a while to watch some TV, then they decided to retire early for the night since they were both tired. Josh had been thinking back to the events at work, and as a result he had an erection straining his pants. Had Marcie been in the mood for fun she might have made use of it, but she didn't even notice.

"Well, time to turn in honey." Josh whispered into his wife's ear, kissing her cheek gently. Even with them both sat down, Josh felt insecure due to his petite new height. But he understood why Ellie had chosen that trait to take from him after her 'victory'. All girls wished to be taller at some point.

"Hmm, okay." Marcie muttered, smiling at her husband.

After they both got upstairs and stripped off for bed, Josh took a moment to study his reflection in the full length mirror on the wall. He was still his usual self... almost, yet he felt so different due to his loss of seven inches in height. He smirked as he rubbed the stiffy in his briefs, thinking ahead to tomorrow and using the device once more. He could not wait for what was in store.

"You okay?" Marcie asked as she climbed into bed.

"Yeah, I'm great sweetie. Just thinking about work tomorrow." Josh replied, being truthful, in part.

"Well, lets concentrate on tonight and getting some sleep huh?" Marcie chuckled, inviting Josh into their bed. He climbed in with her and laid there for about half an hour, before slowly nodding off.
1111332311321313331121132323112.title: Back with Josh.

choices: Ellie looks over the device more.
11113323113213133311211323231122.content:
Ellie eagerly made her way up the stairs to the tea room, ready to start today's shift and latest chapter in the life changing game that she started yesterday with one of her co-workers. 'I didn't think being taller would involve so much work.' Ellie thought to herself, but quickly shrugged it off as she couldn't help but marvel at how much everything seemed to have changed. She thought back to last night and couldn't help but giggle at the thought of her Mum asking her to help put up items on the walls, which until yesterday, was only reserved for when her Uncle came over every few months. Opening the door to the tea room, Ellie saw that Aaron and Steven who seemed to be talking about something that she couldn't hear. She was sure it was something that they both knew since they'd been here for quite a while. Still being one of the newer people, Ellie had had a harder time making friends. Kiran and Jessica could be seen near the window talking about something energetically. Claire and Jodie were also close by talking about something too.

Taking a seat away from everyone else, Ellie took out the device get another look at it. Being careful not to drop it, she opened it and placed it on the table. Looking it over, Ellie found an options button near the top and wondering what it did, pressed the button. As she pressed it, a holographic menu popped up. Speechless at the sight of it, Ellie could only look at the options. Reading silently to herself, she read through the list. 'Device Visibility, Swapping Range, Gender Trait Swaps, Personality.' Her eyes grew wide with this option and opened it up and noticed the words scrolling across the screen. It seemed that the device knew that she wasn't alone and scrolled the words instead of using the speech option.

Personality swaps currently on. Would you like to turn off?
Y/N


Remembering the ordeal from yesterday, Ellie pressed yes. Then she pressed the Gender Trait Swap button.

Gender Trait Swap allows the player to only receive traits from the gender they are currently living.
Would you like to enable?
Y/N


'Hmm... That might be interesting.' She thought to herself and pressed yes.

"Hey there." Josh's voice called out from behind her and caused her to jump in her seat. "Did I scare you." He asked chuckling.

Putting her hand over her chest to try and calm her heart, Ellie watched as he pulled out the seat next to her and sat down. "Well, a little bit." She looked back over at the device, which was still sitting on the table. "Oh, I fixed the whole personality thing."

Josh couldn't help but smile. "Good. Having Charlotte's personality was weird." He shuddered at the thought of it, but quickly shrugged it off. "So do you have an idea of who you want to swap us with?" Deep down, he was hoping to have an idea before hand so that he could try and prepare himself.

Ellie sat there for a moment and thought about it then had an idea. "Well, we could swap our lives out with a couple of customers." She could see the look on her friend's face. "Just hear me out. We could swap with a couple customers and then we can have free range of the store."

Josh could see the gears going inside her head. "Hmm... That way we won't have to work and just walk around the store or even have a meal nearby."

"So you think that would be okay?" Ellie asked, hoping to see if he would eagerly jump on board and watched as he nodded his head. "Really?"

"Yeah, do you have an idea on what kind of customers you want to swap us with?" He asked as he moved his foot so that he could sit on it, trying an attempt to be a little taller.

"Hmm... Well, we could try to be boyfriend and girlfriend, parent and child, or a pair of friends." She replied naming a couple of options. "I mean, it is Friday, so we will have plenty of people to choose from."

Josh thought it over for a moment. "That sounds good." Hearing his phone going off, he looked down to see that it was his wife. Knowing he would hate this, he quickly added. "I will let you pick again, but don't screw me over." He chuckled as he got up and answered the phone.
11113323113213133311211323231122.title: The next day, arrival at work.

111133231132131333112113232311221.content:
"Well, I'll pick for us in a bit, when we've started work, it's too busy in here." Ellie muttered to Josh, looking across at him in his seat, and chuckling when she saw him sat on his leg to elevate himself a little. She decided to wait because Liz had entered the room and she wanted to pocket her device as quickly as possible. Liz was a stickler for personal appliances on the shop floor, and Ellie would either have to put it in her locker before starting work if Liz saw him, or she would have it confiscated.

"Okay, I understand." Josh nodded, looking up and seeing their supervisor. "It'll give you some time to think of what kind of customers you want to swap us with anyway. I trust you'll make good judgement."

"Really? You're trusting me to not swap you with a little girl?" Ellie laughed quietly, nudging Josh.

"Behave yourself, you know what I mean. And I know you're not that mean." Josh nudged his co-worker back, smirking a little and trying to not let on how much being short was bothering him.

A few minutes later, everyone got up, washed their mugs in the sink and put them away in the cupboard, and then all the staff headed downstairs to start their shifts. Little did Liz know that two of her staff would soon be replaced by two random strangers, and she'd be none the wiser. Before going downstairs herself, Ellie was assigned to work with Aaron, which annoyed her a little. Aaron wasn't her favorite person, he was too rough, foul mouthed, overcompensating, all the traits she disliked in a man. If she wasn't planning on swapping lives with a customer, she might have asked Liz to assign her to work with someone else. But as it was... she let it go.

As they reached their designated section, the Seasonal department, they both started working, while Josh got to work on his section some distance away, working with Natalie and having a discussion about the latter's young son.

Ellie decided patience was a virtue, she didn't want to rush into this. She first had to find the customers that she was going to swap herself and Josh with. At least Josh had given her permission to go ahead and swap him already.
111133231132131333112113232311221.title: The shift begins.

choices: the young couple on their honeymoon.
1111332311321313331121132323112213.content:
The shift seemed to go smoothly enough, the shelves were getting filled up in a matter of no-time, Liz was seemingly leaving them both alone, and Aaron was chatting in a more friendly manner that Ellie was used to. Even though she'd been working there for only several weeks, Ellie has seen Aaron's darker side and had since learned to steer the conversations away from what would normally piss him off. It was something that she learned from her Mum from when her Dad would go off and strike both her and her Mum. "Would you look at that?" Aaron replied as he took a moment to admire somebody who walked by. Ellie looked over to see Becca walking by with her flamboyantly red hair and spacious bum, she had always made Ellie uncomfortable to be around. "What I wouldn't give to grab that." He mockingly grabbed air in front of him, as if he was grabbing it for real.

"Do you have to do that?" Ellie asked with an annoyed tone. Seeing such perverted gestured always seemed to turn her mood, no matter how good of a day she'd seemed to be having. "It's so crude and repulsive." Her face seemed to show how she was describing his actions, with her nose curled up in a repulsive manner, almost as if she'd smelled something foul.

"As if you'd know what I'm talking about." Aaron scoffed, looking quite disturbed that the new girl seemed to question his choice in women.

Ellie couldn't help but sigh and kept her mouth shut to avoid any other outburst. Then, like a bolt out of the blue, she had a mischievous idea. While Aaron's back was turned, Ellie took a quick scan of her co-worker and stepped out of the aisle to do another scan of Becca, who wasn't too far away. "Let's see how he likes to be able to touch those wide hips whenever he wants to." Ellie giggled to herself. She shielded her eyes as the bright flash took place and Becca didn't seem so womanly without her wide hips and bum.

As Ellie was trying her best to teach Aaron a lesson in manner and respect for women, Josh felt something was off. Looking down at his body, he saw that he looked pretty much normal and felt an urge to find Ellie to see if she'd initiated the swap. Ducking out of the aisle to see if he could find his game partner, Josh soon found his way to the aisle that she was sharing with Aaron and looked in shock to see Aaron having a much larger backside than normal. Seeing Ellie coming back to the aisle with a huge grin on her face, Josh marched up to her and as he grew closer, he'd forgotten the height difference between them. Looking up at the much taller Ellie, he cleared his throat. "What did you just do?"

With a shocked look on her face, Ellie looked down at him and back at the device, which was still in her hand. "Oh hey." Ellie quietly replied as she tried her best to hide the device. "What brings you over here?" She asked, trying to quickly change the subject.

"I asked, what did you just do?" He asked again, hoping to get a response. "I just felt like something was off and couldn't put my finger on it. So I came over here to see if you used the device and noticed that you used it on Aaron to get revenge or something?" He stood there for a moment to catch his breath, since he seemingly had forgotten to breathe during the rant.

"Wait..." Ellie replied with a concerned look on her face. "You're telling me that you see the swap that I did on Aaron?" She pulled the device back from behind her and looked at it with a sense of wonder. "I guess, since I allowed you to see the swaps last time, that the effect is still taking effect." She replied under her breath.

"That still doesn't mean that you can just..." Josh tried to complain, but was cut off by Ellie.

"Hey, while you're here, how about we start the next round hmm?" Ellie suggested, trying to steer the conversation into another direction. She was surprised as he seemed to drop the complaint and nodded his head. "Looks like somebody is ready to get his height back."

"You can say that so who are you going to swap us with?" Josh asked quietly as he looked around the store. He saw a young couple who looked to be in their early 20's. The boyfriend looked to be near 6' tall and Josh wondered if he got swapped with him, if he would be taller again. The girl that he was with, looked to be only a few inches taller than his current height but had long blonde hair. With a sly grin on his face, Josh looked back over to Ellie. "How about them?"

Ellie looked over at where he was pointing and saw the young couple who looked to be on their honeymoon and who seemed to be having a great time in the small town. "I thought you were going to let me pick." She wondered out loud as she playfully nudged him with her elbow. "Actually I was thinking about swapping us with them." Ellie replied as she pointed over to the far end of the store where a pair of girls were looking at some of the merchandise. They two of them looked so similar that Josh thought they were twins. 1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.content:
"You're wicked." Josh tutted, shaking his head but nonetheless smiling at his mischievous co-worker as they sauntered through the aisles together. "And wow, Joanne looked weird with 'your' short hair." He giggled in his feminine tone, causing Ellie to poke him in the side.

"I still class it as your hair." Ellie sighed.

"No, we traded fair and square, its your hair now." Josh reminded her. And it was at that exact moment he felt the tingling again. "Oh... incoming trait." He stopped walking and both he and Ellie watched to see what happened. Josh's eyesight suddenly blurred and out of nowhere a pair of dark-rimmed glasses appeared on his face.

"Hey, you're wearing Emily's glasses." Ellie pointed out. And upon closer inspection, she noticed Josh's eyes were now a hazel color. "And those are her eyes too." She smirked once more.

"Really?" Josh mumbled, as he took his new glasses off briefly to see how bad his eyesight was. He could still see the outlines of things at distance, but his vision was blurry. "Woah, yep, I definitely need these now." He nodded, placing them back on his face.

"They suit you actually, much like MY bum does." Ellie nodded, gesturing around to Josh's expansive new tushie.

"Thanks." Josh muttered, slapping his backside gently.

The two of them resumed walking around the store, waiting for more swaps to happen. The fact that they could see their co-workers receiving their traits as well, was amusing to them. Coming across Emily chatting to Rebekah, both Josh and Ellie thought she looked great without glasses. Certainly better than Rebekah looked with Aaron's short black hair. It definitely detracted from her 'cuteness' and 'girlyness' somewhat.
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.title: Josh gets something

1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.content:
The two of them continued to walk through the store chatting like the friends they appeared to be. "So you already know what you want if you win?" Josh asked as they started to look through the housewares section.

"Well, yeah." Ellie chuckled as she nudged him playfully. "I mean, don't you?" She watched as Josh took a moment to choose his words wisely. "Oh, you don't know do you?" She giggled at his predicament which seemed to embarrass him.

"Oh, shut it." Josh grumbled. "I like to wait until the last minute." He quickly added.

"Yeah, just like you did with my hair, huh?" Ellie asked as she was trying to get to the bottom of things.

Josh, not wanting to reveal why he did it, quickly changed the subject. "So what do you want if you win?" He watched as Ellie's scowl turned into a grin.

"I think I'm getting something and it's centering all over my body." She replied with a giddy tone. They both watched as Ellie's skin turned into a darker shade, but uniform. Giggling, Ellie continued to look over her body and lifted her shirt up slightly to look at her mid section. "It's almost like I got a tan without seeing the sun. Look." She showed Josh, who couldn't believe what he was seeing. How was he going to win if she liked the changes she was getting.

"Yeah, looks nice." Josh smiled as he fixed his new glasses. "Do you know who it came from? Wait, that looks like Mona's."

Ellie took a moment and looked it over. "You know what, I think you're right. But right now it's mine." She grabbed Josh by the arm and dragged him out of the aisle. "Come on and let's go check out some other stuff."
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.title: A more drastic swap for Ellie.

1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.content:
It wasn't long before Josh felt another swap coming on. "I'm getting another one already." He told Ellie, who quickly put the lamp she was checking out down and rushed back over to him, her heels click clacking on the hard floor. She looked for signs of any changes to his chest, or his arms maybe, perhaps even signs of his manhood vanishing from under his short blue skirt, but nothing was evident to either her or Josh at first.

"Where's it focused on?" Ellie inquired, getting a little impatient.

"I'm not sure, a little in my head, and I..." Josh answered, before noticing the wedding ring that had appeared on his ring finger. It was a woman's wedding ring, and it was Ellie who recognized it.

"That's Kaysie's ring! You must be married to her husband now." Ellie smirked, finding this extremely amusing.

"Seriously?? I'm married to a guy!?" Josh whined in Natasha's sexy voice.

"Hey, you're technically a woman now, as far as everyone else is concerned, so why shouldn't you be married to a man?" Ellie snickered. "And I suppose that means Kaysie is now single again, lucky thing." She added with a smirk.

"Just great!" Josh sighed. But knowing that he wouldn't have to go home to Kaysie's husband was enough to calm him down. The current swapping round would be over by the end of the day as usual, as Ellie soon pointed out to him.

Ellie soon spoke again. "We'll have to remember that not all swaps are physical, there are a few different kinds."

"Well, if I have to choose, I prefer the physical changes." Josh told her.

"Noted!" Ellie winked.
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.title: Josh gets a big change.

choices: Somebody asks Josh and Ellie a question
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.content:
Ellie couldn't believe all the interesting things that they were getting this round, both mental and physical ones. "You know, I'm kind of jealous." Ellie commented, looking down at Josh's new, feminine ring. "I wish I had a husband to go home to tonight, I know that Joanne only has a boyfriend and from what I read on the Social Media, he's out of town on a business trip."

"Yeah, well you can take it from me if you want." Josh suggested as he tried to take off the ring, but found it too small to get over his masculine knuckles.

"Well, you can always concede and I will win." Ellie replied looking for an easy victory.

"I bet you would like that wouldn't you." Josh chuckled as he put his hands back down, having given up with the ring.

"You know I would...." Ellie trailed off as she felt something tingle on the lower part of her body. "I think I'm getting something." She looked down at the lower portion of her body and Josh followed her gaze. They watched as her feminine looking legs transformed into a pair of skinny, longer, and definitely masculine pair. "Bloody hell. Whose are these?" She cursed as she continued to look at the unsightly pair of legs now on the lower half of her body. "Why am I the only one getting guy parts?"

Josh couldn't help but chuckle, but with Natasha's voice, it sounded more like a giggle. "I don't know, but those things are certainly awful looking."

"Yeah, laugh it up." Ellie replied back with an abrasive tone. "Just wait until I win and I will make take something from you that you really like."

Not missing a beat, Josh replied back. "Well you might want to take care of those legs first, because they look as hairy as an ape's."

*** Meanwhile across the store ***


Liam didn't feel a thing when he shrunk a couple of inches and his legs took on a more feminine tone. "Come on Liam." Joanne replied, currently living Ellie's life. "Liz really wants us to get this done within the next hour."

Rolling his eyes, in a bored manner, Liam put his phone away in his pocket but seemed to be having a harder time due to his more feminine thighs, and made his way over to Joanne. "Fine."
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.title: Ellie's turn again.

1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.content:
Ellie and Josh merrily made their way through the aisles, with their heels clicking as they did. "You know this is kind of fun." Josh replied looking over at Ellie. "I mean, it's nice not having to work and getting paid for it."

Ellie looked over at him and grinned wryly. "Yeah and all you have to do is walk around in a dress and heels." She poked him jokingly in the side. "Come on Rachel." She made sure to put and emphasis on his new name and grabbed his hands, pulling him towards the end of the aisle. "We have to go check out the makeup again."

"Do I have to?" Josh groaned with Natasha's sultry voice. "We just did that yesterday." He pointed out as he did his best to stall.

"Sounds like somebody doesn't want to do something today." Rob's voice responded to them, almost as if he was trying to come on to them. "Hi, I'm Rob." He held out his hand to Josh.

Not wanting to be rude, Josh held out his and subconsciously showed Rob the ring on his finger that belonged to Kaysie. Josh noticed the ring and smiled as he replied. "Sorry, but I'm married."

Rob didn't miss a beat. "What he doesn't know sweetie won't hurt him." His eyes grew bigger when he saw Liz coming towards them. Josh pulled his hand away in disgust.

"What is going on here?" Liz asked with an authoritative voice. "Rob, do we need to go have a talk?"

"No, I was just introducing myself and was about to ask them if they needed any help." Rob added, trying to avoid getting in trouble.

Sensing something wasn't right, Liz decided to send him on his way. "Now, is there anything that I can help you with Joanne?"

Josh was about to ask something, but was soon interrupted with Ellie. "No, I think we know where we're going." Liz nodded her head and waved them goodbye.
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.title: Rob comes to hit on Josh

1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.content:
"God, I feel so unnattractive with these legs, I wish I knew who's they were." Ellie grumbled, looking down at her hairy, skinnier legs. What made it worse was that they didn't match the skin tone of the rest of Ellie's body after she swapped with Mona earlier. But then... they did better match the narrow hips and flatter ass she had got from Josh himself.

"You can always admit defeat, and then get your own legs back," Josh chuckled, enjoying Ellie's discomfort maybe a tad too much. "Unless I decide I want them as a prize." He snickered.

"Yeah you'd like that, but I'm not giving in." Ellie said firmly, sticking her tongue out at Josh, before abruptly stopping in her tracks as she felt a tingling sensation once more. "Here we go again." She mumbled, bracing herself as Josh also stoppd to observe any change that happened, providing it was physical. She felt her muscles tighten up slightly, her stomach became more toned and she got a definite 'athletic' appearance that made her legs look slightly less scrawny, but not much.

"Wow, you're... fit!" Josh said, after the swap had happened.

Emily checked herself out, briefly exposing her tummy to check out her new modest abs. She knew she didn't have a man's muscles, since they weren't pronounced enough. "I think I swapped with Natasha again." She said,

"I think you're right." Josh answered, in Natasha's voice no less. "She's being targeted a lot in this little random swapping game of ours." He chuckled.

"Well, it's not as though she's aware, now is it?" Ellie shrugged, unconcerned as she started walking again.

Josh followed in her tracks.
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.title: Ellie feels another change coming.

1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.content:
Ellie and Josh continued to wander the store and couldn't help but marvel at what was going on. Sure it was the third day of the game, but with each trait they got, the game changed slightly. Ellie scratched her defined white legs and grimaced at the amount of hair that was on them. Even though she had all of Josh's hair, she still wasn't used to it and found it gross. Josh seemed to see her discomfort and replied over to her. "You know all you have to do is say the word and it will be gone." He grinned at her discomfort.

"Yeah, yeah." Ellie replied as she thought about it but shook it off. "I know, but I really want to win this round." As she shook her head she felt an odd tingle starting to occur within her head. "Whoa."

Josh glanced over to her and wondered what was going on. "What?" He asked with Natasha's voice. "Wait, did you just get something else?"

Ellie looked over at Josh and noticed his feminine glasses and long blond hair. The more he looked at him and the more that he spoke, Ellie felt something deep inside of her stir. "I... I don't know." She looked back over at him and her eyes went down to her ass that now found its home on Josh and felt a yearning deep inside her. "I think I did."

Josh looked at her body up and down and didn't see anything that recently changed. He saw the really manly looking and the now toned body that she had. "You don't look any different. Unless you got a..." He brought his hands up to his mouth and let out an audible gasp. "What changed?"

"I don't know, I think it might by my sexuality." She blushed at the announcement. "I mean, I look at some of the stuff that you got and I feel this deep yearning within me." Josh couldn't help but laugh at her predicament. "It's not funny."

*** Several Aisles over ***


Rob didn't feel anything different as he looked over at Jessica. "Hey Jess." Rob whispered as he turned to her. "Don't you think that guy is hot?" He motioned over to a man who just walked into their aisle. He towered over the both of them and certainly looked like he loved to work out in his free time.
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.title: Whoops, another swap for Ellie.

choices: Another swap persuades Ellie to quit.
Josh gets a little something more.
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.content:
Josh was so busy enjoying Ellie’s apparent discomfort, and teasing her with her own former traits as well as the others he had received, that he didn’t feel the faint tingle occurring in his own head this time. Instead her kept tormenting Ellie a little until he said something that Ellie thought was ‘odd’. “You’d make a perfect date for my friend Maddy now.” He giggled in Natasha’s voice.

Ellie glanced over at Josh with a frown on her face. “Wait... isn’t Maddy a friend of Charlotte’s? I’ve heard her mention her several times, the horny lesbian, right?” She mumbled.

Josh paused, thinking things over for a second. “Um... yeah, I think you’re right, but... “ He said, unsure at first, but as he thought about all his friends now, they were all college aged or slightly younger, and most of them were girls.

“I think you swapped with Charlotte.” Ellie said, scratching her right leg again due to the hair itching her.

“I think you maybe right. But what did we swap, our friends? Seems like a weird thing to trade.” Josh shrugged.

Ellie rolled her eyes. “We’re playing a game in which we randomly swap traits with our co-workers Josh, the whole thing is weird.” She reminded him. “And this time it seems you’re getting all the luck.” Ellie continued, feeling hard done by this round. She was actually thinking of forfeiting, but didn’t want to admit it just yet.

“Luck of the draw love.” Josh smirked, straightening Emily’s former glasses on his face.

“Yeah right!” Ellie groaned, shaking her head gently as she kept walking.
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.title: Josh gets something.

1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.content:
Ellie couldn't believe her luck, she started out with a great swap with getting Joanne's life. Being able to complete her job along with getting her hair seemed to be the best, even if she had to shrink a little from Josh's normal 5' 10" height. But then the odd swaps started to happen. Between the new skin tone, losing her own bum to Josh, and then there were her legs. The hairyness of them didn't seem to be too bad, thanks in not part to having Josh's hair experience, but it just felt wrong. Ellie sighed at the predicament. "What's wrong?" Josh chuckled with Natasha's voice. "Are you ready to quit? Because all you have to do is say 'I quit!' and it will be over."

There was a slight humming coming from the remote and Ellie pulled it out to examine it.

Does Player Josh wish to concede the match to Player Ellie?
Y/N

Ellie giggled at Josh's perplexed face. "No, I don't wish to quit." Josh quickly responded and almost instantly heard the remote stop humming. It seemed to go back to it's hibernation mode. "That was close."

"I was hoping that you would mess up and I would get the match." She gently put her arm around his shoulder. As she did, Ellie felt the odd tingle once more and it seemed to center around her whole body once more. Looking down she noticed that she still had Mona's skin tone, but it seemed to be hairier somehow. Looking at it a bit further she noticed that it seemed to be a bit darker than she normally saw. "Aww man, this is so gross." She noticed the dark hair covering most of her body and found that her chest was now coated with a layer of hair. "Where did it all come from?" She looked over at Josh.

"Don't look at me, it's not mine." He brought his arm up to show Ellie that he still had her original hair still. "Come to think of it, I think it may be Darrell's."

"I can't do this anymore." Ellie whined. "I want to have my body back and live my life again. I quit." She cried to the remote.

Does Player Ellie wish to concede the match to Player Josh?
Y/N

"Yes. I concede to Josh." Ellie sobbed as she felt the world around her begin to swirl. Once the swirling stopped, Ellie and Josh looked around to see that they were back in their own bodies. Ellie, having Josh's hair on her head and body, but also his height. Josh, having Ellie's longer hair on his head, but also her smaller height.

Player Josh may pick his prize from Player Ellie!

"Well what are you going to pick?" Ellie blushed as she tried to look away.

"Hmm..." Josh thought for a moment. "What will I pick!?"

"Just get on with it." Ellie demanded, wanting to get done with the waiting.

"Fine, I think I will take your _______." Josh declared with little fanfare.

"Wait, no." Ellie cried out. "Not that."
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.title: Another swap persuades Ellie to quit.

choices: Ellie takes her frustration out on someone.
The rest of the shift passes quickly.
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.content:
As soon as those words left her lips... Ellie felt a tingle in her throat and she raised a hand to caress her neck as an Adams Apple formed. She gulped, afraid to speak, that is until Josh spoke first. "Oh wow... I sound sexy!" Josh exclaimed in Ellie's sing song voice, he even had her cute English accent. "My name is Ellie Rose Kirk, I'm pleased to meet you!" he said, teasing Ellie, who remained silent, scowling at him. "Come on Ellie, you've got to speak sooner or later." he giggled in his feminine tone as he flicked his long hair back and folded his arms, looking up at Ellie.

"You knew this would piss me off!" Ellie growled in Josh's deep, American accented voice. "Why take my voice?" she asked him, gesturing with her arms and making her displeasure clear.

"Why not?" Josh shrugged, smirking. "Goes well with my hair and smooth skin, right? Plus... I did win, and the rules say..."

"I KNOW about the rules Josh!" Ellie snapped at him. "But you... are you really enjoying having feminine traits that much?" she inquired with a deep sigh.

"It's all so different, so exciting, and I'm sure you must be feeling it too, maybe somewhere under all that anger?" he replied, tilting his head and giving her a sly grin. But he could see he'd upset her even more this time by taking her voice as his prize. Losing her hair was bad enough.

"It's started losing it's attraction, let's just say that." Ellie grumbled in her masculine voice.

Josh sighed, sounding just like Ellie used to sound when she was slightly annoyed. "Look, we both agreed to play this game, and we knew what could happen. And we both agreed to let the winner take a trait of their choice if they won. So what's the problem?"

Ellie looked down an aisle at nothing in particular, then ran her slender fingers through her short hair. "Fine, let's just move on!" she grunted reluctantly. As Ellie pouted she pulled the remote from her pocket again and looked at it. Like picking on me don't you. she thought, as Josh moved to one side to help a customer momentarily. I WILL win the next round, I have to! she told herself, and she was already thinking what trait of Josh's she could take as a prize that would really irritate him.
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.title: Voice

choices: Ellie uses the remote to let off some steam.
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.content:
Josh knew better than to egg on Ellie anymore. With her possessing the remote, she had the power to swap him around in ways beyond his own imagination. He looked at the work that he still had to do and was glad that he didn't need to do too much. "Hmm... Just a couple more boxes and I will need to clean up." He said out loud to himself but he still couldn't get past how much he sounded like Ellie, both voice and accent.

"Done already?" Liz asked as she came down his aisle, seemingly pleased at the fact that he had worked so quickly.

"Yeah, I guess you can say that today just flew by." Josh replied and chuckled silently at his own joke.

"Umm... Okay." Liz didn't know what he was saying or why he found it funny. "Look, I need you to head over and help Ellie finish up. She still has half a stack to finish before she is done." Liz could see Josh's face go from a smile to a frown. "Oh, don't give me that, I've seen you two over the past several days and noticed that you both have been almost attached to the hip. So put your hair up in a bun and go help her out, okay?" Josh nodded his head and finished up this section.

*** Several minutes later ***

Ellie had remained silent since her latest swap with Josh. She had thought about using the remote and taking out her frustrations on some of her co-workers, but decided to get everything done before she started having fun. "Need any help over here?" She heard her voice call out from behind her. She cleared her throat and did her best in trying to avoid it. "Look, if I did something wrong, I'm sorry."

"You seem to find it amusing when you take traits from me and seem to relish in wanting to make me look like an ogre." She gestured to her hair and throat.

"Look, I had no intention of doing that, you have to believe me." Josh started to plead. "After I couldn't get my height back, I took whatever made you happy. Hence where your hair came into play.

"What about my voice?" Ellie wondered as she crossed her arms across her chest.

Josh sighed and knew he didn't have any other option. "Well, I liked the way you hum along to songs." He blushed. "Look I know you're mad, but I think we should talk about tomorrows game." This seemed to make Ellie think about it. "I was thinking that we could get into a couple or something close like that."

"That does seem intriguing, but I will have to think it over." Ellie smiled. "I'm still mad at you remember."
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.title: The rest of the shift passes quickly.

choices: The end of the shift soon arrives.
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.content:
Still grumbling to herself, a clearly irritated Ellie now looked around for someone to release her frustration on, and as if on cue, Liam strolled into view, yawning and being his usual lazy self. Ellie had hated having Liam's hairy legs swapped to her, not that it was his fault, he'd known nothing about it after all. But now Ellie had him in her sights and she needed to vent. Activating the device, she brought up Liam's image and personal details, then she selected someone to swap him with.

That other person was Kiran, busy chatting to her good friend Jessica as they finished up some work together. Bringing up Kiran's image alongside Liam's, Ellie selected their heights and then hit the swap button. Looking up, Ellie's face cracked a slight smirk as she saw Liam start shrinking in height, from his usual 5'8"... down to 5'6"... 5'4".. 5'2"... he plummeted down to just 5'0" tall, his trousers automatically adjusting size to fit his shorter legs and his shirt also becoming a smaller size. The remote's reality altering effects never stopped amazing Ellie. Meanwhile, the opposite had happened to the usually petite Kiran, her body undergoing a rapid growth spurt of eight inches... making her the same height as Jessica was in her high heels. And as with Liam, Kiran's waist-high trousers lengthened to accomodate the growth she experienced, and her shirt became a 'Medium' size instead of a 'Small'.

"You taking it out on others?" Ellie heard he former voice again chime up from behind her. Josh was observing her actions.

"Do you want me to take it out on YOU?" Ellie replied in her deep, American voice, glaring back at the purloiner of her lovely hair and voice.

Josh raised his hands and backed up a little, returning to work. He didn't say anything else for fear of pissing Ellie off further. This allowed Ellie to continue venting, and having turned Liam into the shortest employee in the store, she looked around for another unsuspecting co-worker.
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.title: Ellie uses the remote to let off some steam.

choices: Ellie invites Josh to do something after work.
Josh's wife surprises him after work.
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.content:
Ellie couldn't help but giggle a little to herself as she watched her new friend back away from her. It was almost as if he was afraid of her and the power that she had in her hands. 'If only I can make him quit before I do.' She thought to herself as she tried to look like she was keeping busy. Looking over at him and how much smaller he looked with her old height, Ellie was thinking that she might have a way to get him to quit. "Say, Joshie." Ellie smirked as she watched him shudder at the nickname she liked to call him. "You said that you wanted to try something new this next round, right?"

"Yeah, why do you ask, love?" He nodded his head as he replied with Ellie's own voice and accent. "Bloody hell, I think your accent is getting to me."

Ellie couldn't help but laugh at his predicament. "Well you can always give it back to me. I don't think you will want people to think that you're a girl right?" She pointed over to his hair. "I mean with such feminine hair and with your height."

"Whoa." Josh held up his had to stop her. "You gave me your height remember?"

"All I'm trying to say is that we should keep playing is all." Ellie replied.

"I know what you're doing." Josh realized. "You're trying to guilt me into trading some of your parts back to you."

"I would never." Ellie feign ignorance and hoped that Josh would buy it. "I was just thinking that we can get a closer relationship than the twins we were on day two."

"Closer how exactly?" Josh wondered.

"Oh you'll see." Ellie chuckled slightly. "And I think you'll look at life in a new light." Josh gulped in fear of what the next day has to offer.
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.title: Ellie thinks over Josh's 'suggestion'.

1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.content:
"Not even a hint of what you have planned? Come on Ellie..." Josh whined in his co-worker's female, English voice, sounding like a proper girl.

Ellie just shook her head, peering down at her now 5'3" co-worker. "No, you can wait and see tomorrow." she informed him in his own, deep voice. "Now come on and let's get finished up here, the shift is almost over and I don't want Liz on my back again."

"Fine!! Have your secrets." Josh grumbled, making sure his long feminine hair was still secured in a messy bun, as Liz had advised. The two of them then finished up their work together and tidied up their section. "Don't forget the safety knives." Josh told Ellie, pointing up to where she'd put both their knives, on a top shelf that he could no longer reach due to his height swap with her.

"Got em'!" Ellie muttered, scratching the stubble on her chin before grabbing the knives.

After that, everyone headed upstairs to collect their belongings. And in the locker room, Ellie pushed her way past Liam, the shortest co-worker now that Ellie had given him Kiran's height. "See ya titch!" she laughed at him, eliciting a scowl from Liam.

"See you tomorrow Josh for another round." Ellie winked at Josh outside, teasing him further by still not telling him what she had in mind.

Josh sighed, smirked, then took the two hairbands out of his hair and let it fall down around his shoulders, then running his fingers through it. He really was starting to love having Ellie's favorite traits, and he didn't regret taking them from her. He hummed a tune in his cute new voice and then went home to his wife Marcie.
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.title: Ellie goes home.

choices: A newlywed couple on their honeymoon
A couple of girls getting ready to leave the store.
1111332311321313331121132323112213211221.content:
Ellie had a somewhat restful night, besides the annoying itching from her legs and arms. "I think I should have put some lotion on last night." She said to herself with her deeper voice, as she remembered back to what her Mom had said about shaving tends to dry out the skin and would cause the itchiness. She sighed as she swung her legs over the bed and stood up. Looking in the nearby mirror she noticed her new darker 'morning shadow' on her face. She brought her hand up to her cheek and felt the scruffy feeling. She sighed, missing her normally smooth skin. Just then a figure passed by the door and stopped at the door way.

"Oh, you're up." Her Mom replied with a feeling of mock surprise. "I was about to wake you up. I washed your uniform for you since I was doing a load myself." Usually her and her Mom usually did their own laundry. She tended to say that it was a life skill that she needed to know how to do.

"Thanks." She stretched trying her best to wake up. Thinking about the best way to get Josh to quit early she had what seemed like a light bulb going off. "Mum, I'm going to go take a shower and get ready."

Several hours later, Josh sat waiting in the tea room for Ellie to show up. He didn't get much sleep the night before with the anticipation of what she was going to choose for them. 'Maybe I shouldn't have said that I would let her pick again.' He thought to himself, having second thoughts about the previous night. He looked around to see if Ellie had arrived. When he brought his gaze over to the door, he saw her tall form starting to come through it. She seemed to have a beaming smile on her face for some reason.

"I know you're wanting to stretch your wings, but I have an appointment coming in shortly."

"An appointment?" Josh whispered to himself as he quietly made his way to the door, but didn't see one of the floorboards seemed to be undone causing his foot to catch and making him fall forward through the door.

"See I told you, he would be here." The old voice cackled to the group of birds. The owner of the old voice held out a gnarled old hand reached out to help him up. "Here, my dear boy."

113.content:
The birds began to sing in the trees near the Wilko store and Claire really didn't feel like going in. 'Such a beautiful day.' She thought to herself. Indeed it was, the temperature barely reached up into the 80s and the humidity was rather low, mostly due to the passing of a cold front a few days earlier. All of these made for the beautiful day that the township of Rotherham had been enjoying. Claire reluctantly made her way across the street to the front of the store, but was a little too engrossed in her phone to see an older gentlemen coming out of the store at the same time. Ultimately the two collided, causing the both of them to tumble to the floor.

"You stupid girl!" The older man scolded as he looked around for his glasses that fell from his face when they collided. Claire looked over at the older man and noticed that he was rather unkept. His long white hair looked rather frayed and burned in places, his beard appeared to be patchy, and his clothes smelled of mothballs and of old smoke.

Not really liking being called a stupid girl, Claire swallowed her pride and quickly got up to help the older man return to his feet. This, however, proved to be fruitless. As she stood on her own feet, Claire heard a cracking sound and instantly knew something was wrong. "Uh oh." She sighed as she looked down to see the old man's glasses were now under her feet and in multiple pieces. "I'm so sorry." Claire replied as she bent down to recover the broken pieces, but was soon cut short by the older man.

"Every time I come to this store, something always goes wrong." He blustered as he got up and started to walk away, but seemed to stop as he thought of something. "Between the rude staff not wanting to help you, the male staff members trying to get into the pants of the ladies, and the little girls not looking where they are going, this store needs a look at a new perspective." That's when the proverbial light bulb went off above his head.

When the light of day begins to wane,
those employed will begin to obtain
the traits that others treasure most
will soon find another host.


Much to her disbelief, the bright and sunny day instantly turned stormy and the claps of thunder overhead frightened Claire a little. She looked back over to the older man and saw that he was gone. Looking all around, no sign of him remained at all and even the glasses that she stepped on were gone and looked like they were never there. "What in the world?" She said to herself as she shrugged her shoulders and begrudgingly went inside for her shift. As she entered, she felt a small shiver go down her spine. It was like her Grandmother told her. A rabbit must of gone over my grave.

"Hey, love." Elizabeth chimed in her normal cheerful manner.

"Hey Elizabeth." Claire responded back to her manager. "I have a question for you." Elizabeth stopped what she was doing and went over to the young lady. "Was there an old man in here about 5 to 10 minutes ago?"

Elizabeth stood there for a second trying to think back. "Come to think of it, there was an older man that came up to me saying that there wasn't anybody helping him find what he needed. He seemed a little out of it if you ask me. Why do you ask?"

"Oh, no reason." Claire announced as she waved her manager good bye.

Still chagrined at the event just witnessed, and still feeling a little guilty about crushing the old man's glasses, Claire made her way up to the tea room and pushed the door open, walking inside. There were five of her co-workers in there, and more would undoubtedly be arriving shortly, since the shift started in 15 minutes.

"Hey you." Ellie smiled at Claire when she saw her. Ellie was as friendly as Claire was, and was the fourth newest employee after Daniel, Claire and David.

"Hi Ellie." Claire managed a warm smile, trying to forget what had happened outside as she took a seat next to her friend. Claire then took a look around at who else was in the room. Mona was sat nearest her and Ellie, but she was reading a Kindle like she often did before work. Kiran was sat just two places from Mona, eating a bag of doritos and sending a text on her iphone which was laid on the table in front of her. And across by the window, Aaron and Josh were stood chatting about something that Claire couldn't make out. But given the interests of the guys she worked with, it was probably something boring to her.

After a moment's silence, Claire started talking to Ellie, explaining what had happened outside with the old man who had vanished into thin air. "That's weird, are you... are you sure you didn't imagine it?" Ellie asked, slipping her tongue in her cheek as she prepared to take a drink from her Diet Pepsi.

"No I didn't imagine it." Claire stated, feeling slightly insulted. But then she frowned, and her nose twitched. "At least I don't think I did. I definitely stepped on his glasses, and he was definitely angry. And Elizabeth remembered seeing him as well, when he was complaining about the service downstairs." She said.

"Well, if he's gone, it's over." Ellie smiled. "Just forget it happened."

"I guess..." Claire sighed, still not sure what had happened outside. But she couldn't help but have a sense of foreboding as she sat back and looked across at Aaron and Josh for a moment.

After 10-15 minutes, Liz came into the tea room to start gathering up all the workers for the start of the shift. "Okay, we have a busy night tonight and we will need to have everybody on deck so that we can get all the work that needs to be done, done." She looked around and noticed that she had most of their attention. "Kiran and Liam, loves, I really need your attention please." Kiran blushed slightly at being reprimanded by her supervisor, while Liam, not really caring about what he was doing, just sighed and reluctantly put his phone away.

"Sorry, Liz." Kiran apologized as she put her phone back into her locker.

"It's alright." Liz replied as she posted a paper up on the board so that everyone knew where they were going to be working. "Elizabeth told me that if you guys get everything done before it's time to go, you all will be able to leave early tonight." This seemed to put a new bounce in everybody's step as they made their way over to the staffing board to see who they will be working with.

"Aww, man." Josh grumbled as he glanced over at the work assignments. "I really don't like working in the pet food aisle. Does anybody want to swap with me?"

"I will." Claire responded as she raised her hand. "If you don't mind working in the seasonal aisle." In the last couple shifts, she'd had to work with the same girls and wanted a small break.

Josh looked over at the work assignments and noticed that he'd be working with Ellie and Phoebe. "I guess I can do that."

"Okay, no more changes." Liz replied as she put her foot down. "Let's go back to work."
